column1: Goodyear has a subtropical desert climate (Köppen: BWh) due to its location in the Sonoran Desert. The city receives somewhere around ten inches of rain annually. The city has more than 300 sunny days per year.

Winters are sunny with mild temperatures—nighttime lows averaging between 40 °F and 50 °F (4 °C and 10 °C) and daytime highs ranging from 60 °F to 75 °F (16 °C to 24 °C). The lowest temperature ever recorded in Goodyear is 16 °F (-9 °C). Summers are very hot
column2: with daily high temperatures at or above 100 °F (38 °C) for the entirety of June
column3: July
column4: and August
column5: as well as many days in May and September. An occasional heat wave will spike temperatures over 115 °F (46 °C) briefly. Nighttime lows in the summer months average between 70 °F and 80 °F (21 °C and 27 °C)
column6: with an occasional overnight low above 80 °F (27 °C) not uncommon. The highest recorded temperature in Goodyear is 125 °F (52 °C).

column1: Snow is rare in the area
column2: occurring once every several years. Lows in the winter occasionally dip below freezing
column3: which may damage some desert plants such as saguaros and other cacti. In the summer (mainly July
column4: August and early September)
column5: the North American Monsoon can hit the Phoenix area in the afternoon and evening (possibly continuing overnight)
column6: causing thunderstorms and heavy rain even from a sunny morning. Dust storms are occasional

column1: Goodyear has a council-manager form of government. The current mayor is Georgia Lord
column2: who was elected to fill a two-year unexpired term as Mayor of the City of Goodyear in March 2011
column3: was re-elected to serve a second term as Mayor in 2013
column4: and was elected to serve her final term in 2017. The mayor has a two-term limit. The vice mayor of the city is Wally Campbell
column5: who was first elected in 2011. There are six councilmembers
column6: with three-term limits.The Arizona Department of Corrections operates the Arizona State Prison Complex-Perryville in Goodyear. The prison houses the female death row.

column1: Several school districts serve the city of Goodyear. Elementary school districts include Avondale Elementary School District
column2: Liberty Elementary School District
column3: Litchfield Elementary School District
column4: and Mobile Elementary School District. High school districts include Agua Fria Union High School District and Buckeye Union High School District.

column1: Goodyear is known as a site for professional baseball teams' spring training sessions. The Cleveland Indians of Major League Baseball's American League moved their spring training facility to Goodyear from Winter Haven
column2: Florida and rejoined the Cactus League in February 2009
column3: after a 15-year absence. Before that
column4: the Indians held spring training for many years in Tucson.

column3: Goodyear's city council unanimously approved a memorandum to fund a new $33 million baseball spring training complex for Major League Baseball's Cincinnati Reds and Cleveland Indians. This includes a 10
column4: 000-seat park
column6: that opened in 2009. The Reds and the Indians have separate offices
column7: clubhouses and practice fields. The Indians had held their spring training in Tucson for many years until moving to Winter Haven in 1993. They agreed in 2006 to return their spring training location to Arizona at Goodyear.

column1: Phoenix Goodyear Airport is located here. It has an 8
column2: 500 ft runway capable of handling large jet aircraft. This airport
column3: used by many international airlines for aircraft maintenance and storage
column4: has no active commercial air service.

column4: in the east. MC 85 (Maricopa County Highway 85) is a highway running from Arizona State Route 85 in Buckeye to central Phoenix. The highway passes the southern sections of Goodyear.

column1: Interstate 10 was built through Goodyear in the late 20th century. Between 2008 and 2014
column2: the road had significant expansions. It was expanded from 2 lanes in each direction to 5 or 6 (including one HOV lane starting near Loop 303 going east). There were also new interchanges
column3: including Exit 122 (Perryville Road)
column4: Exit 123 (Citrus Road) and Exit 125 (Sarival Avenue).

column1: The Arizona Department of Transportation built a new interchange near the Interstate 10/Loop 303 junctions. The interchange is being expanded from a diamond interchange to a stack interchange. As a result
column2: Loop 303 under Interstate 10 was cleared
column3: and Exit 124 on Interstate 10 has been shut down; the new interchange was completed in 2014.

column2: Loop 303 is being planned to extend to a future State Route 30.

column1: Arizona State Route 30 (originally designated as State Route 801) is a proposed highway south of Interstate 10 that will relieve traffic congestion. It is planned to run between Arizona State Route 85 to Loop 202.
